Class EffectLib

  • java.lang.Object
    • EffectLib

  • public final class EffectLib
extends java.lang.Object
    This class collaborates with Game class and processes all effects. It also provides target selection requirements for targeting effect and string descriptions for all effects. This class is only to be accessed the static way.

    All uncommented methods are functional methods for different effects to actually execute. They are basic individual simple effects and are invoked through and only through processEffect(String, Card, Game, Player, Player) and proceedEffect(Card, Player).

    See Also:
    Game.sendEffect(String, Card, Player, Card, Player)

        private static int getVariable(java.lang.String var)

        Parameters:
        var - the variable string. It is later to be interpreted to variable to be checked in game
        Returns:
        the actual value for the effect

      • proceedEffect

        public static void proceedEffect(Card card,
                                 Player owner)
        This method takes the card player selected as effect target and proceeds the unfinished effect processing. reset() is called at the end to clear up.
        Parameters:
        card - the selected card target
        owner - the owner of the card target

      • processEffect

        public static EffectLib.Response processEffect(java.lang.String effect,
                                               Card source,
                                               Game g,
                                               Player originPlayer,
                                               Player oppoPlayer)
        This methods processes the effect. All effects must be passed to this method first. It returns the result of the process for the Game class to further process. The method will call reset() if the effect is completely processed.
        Parameters:
        effect - effect to be processed
        source - the origin card of the effect
        g - the game object reference
        originPlayer - the player that owns the origin card
        oppoPlayer - the opponent player to the origin player
        Returns:
        the response of the effect process. EffectLib.Response.DONE if the effect is successfully processed. EffectLib.Response.FAIL if the effect failed to execute(due to unmet effect activation requirements). All other return values indicates that further target selection is required to proceed the effect.
        See Also:
        EffectLib.Response

      • willActivate

        private static boolean willActivate(java.lang.String condition)
        This method determines whether a method with prerequisites can be activated or not.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition string from the effect. It is later interpreted as conditions to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the effect can be activated, false otherwise
